Gebirgstruppe|version=114569301|insertversion=565785176|small=no}}
== Merge ==
These two pages (this one and [[Kaisersch端tzen]]) seem to be about the exact same regiments. Is there any reason to have two separate articles here? -[[Special:Contributions/165.234.252.11|165.234.252.11]] ([[User talk:165.234.252.11|talk]]) 15:29, 26 August 2016 (UTC)
:No they're different but related, but thanks for raising this as more work is needed. The ''[[Kaisersch端tzen]]'' were the Tyrolean territorial rifles until 1906; originally there were 10 battalions, then 3 regiments reducing to just two. In 1906 the two surviving regiments and a newly raised 3rd regiment of ''Kaisersch端tzen'', together with two line infantry regiments, were retrained into [[mountain infantry]] and collectively became the [[Imperial-Royal Mountain Troops|''Gebirgstruppe'']] after that. So they cover two different periods of history and two different roles. Moreover the ''Gebirgstruppe'' were not just formed from ''Kaisersch端tzen'', but from ordinary line infantry. So like German Wikipedia, it seems sensible to maintain them as separate articles but make the relationship much clearer whilst ensuring there is minimal duplication. --[[User:Bermicourt|Bermicourt]] ([[User talk:Bermicourt|talk]]) 16:26, 26 August 2016 (UTC)
::Oh, that does make sense. -[[Special:Contributions/165.234.252.11|165.234.252.11]] ([[User talk:165.234.252.11|talk]]) 17:02, 26 August 2016 (UTC)
